briefdescription.para: Initializes model parameters, bathymetry, friction, initial conditions, and output variables.

detaileddescription.para: Sets up the initial state of the simulation, including bathymetry, friction maps, evolving variables, river forcing, boundary blocks, active cells, and output arrays.

briefdescription.para: Initializes bathymetry gradient and halo on CPU.

detaileddescription.para: Computes gradients and refines bathymetry for the model blocks on the CPU.

briefdescription.para: Initializes bathymetry gradient and halo on GPU.

detaileddescription.para: Computes gradients and refines bathymetry for the model blocks using CUDA streams and kernels.

briefdescription.para: Initializes output arrays and maps for the simulation.

detaileddescription.para: Sets up storage for evolving parameters, output zones, and output files.

briefdescription.para: Initializes time series output files for specified nodes.

detaileddescription.para: Creates and overwrites output files for each node in the time series output list.

briefdescription.para: Finds and assigns output nodes to blocks for time series output.

detaileddescription.para: Determines which block each output node belongs to and updates the boundary block structure.

briefdescription.para: Initializes river discharge areas and assigns river information to model blocks.

detaileddescription.para: Identifies grid cells affected by river discharge, calculates discharge areas, and sets up river-block relationships.

briefdescription.para: Initializes output variable maps and metadata for the simulation.

detaileddescription.para: Sets up output variable names, units, and long names for all tracked quantities in the model.

briefdescription.para: Finds and assigns blocks to output zones based on user-defined rectangular areas.

detaileddescription.para: Determines which blocks belong to each output zone, computes zone boundaries, and updates the block structure. Initialise all storage involving parameters of the outzone objects

briefdescription.para: Initializes output zones for the simulation domain.

detaileddescription.para: Sets up output zones based on user input or defaults to the full domain if none specified.

briefdescription.para: Initializes boundary block assignments and segment information.

detaileddescription.para: Finds boundary blocks, assigns them to segments, and allocates arrays for segment sides and flow.

listitem.para: Initialise bnd blk assign block to their relevant segment allocate memory...
Find all the boundary blocks(block with themselves as neighbours)
make an array to store which segment they belong to

detaileddescription.para:
If any bnd segment was specified
scan each block and find which (if any) segment they belong to For each segment Calculate bbox if inbbox calc inpoly if inpoly overwrite assingned segment with new one
Calculate nblk per segment & allocate (do for each segment)
fill segment and side arrays for each segments

briefdescription.para: Calculates the number of blocks on each boundary of the domain.

detaileddescription.para: Updates counts for left, right, top, and bottom boundaries and stores them in the forcing and parameter structures.

memberdef.argsstring: (Param XParam, Model< T > XModel, Forcing< float > &XForcing)
memberdef.name: Findbndblks

briefdescription.para: Finds which blocks on the model edge belong to a side boundary.

detaileddescription.para: Populates arrays for blocks on each side boundary and updates the forcing structure.

T
Data type
XParam
Simulation parameters
XModel
Model data
XForcing
Forcing data (float)
Find which block on the model edge belongs to a "side boundary"

memberdef.argsstring: (Param &XParam, BlockP< T > &XBlock, double xo, double yo, double xmax, double ymax, bool isEps, std::vector< int > &cornerblk)
memberdef.name: RectCornerBlk

briefdescription.para: Finds the blocks containing the corners of a rectangular box (for output zone definition).

detaileddescription.para: Returns indices of blocks through "cornerblk" at the corners of the rectangle, starting from bottom left and turning clockwise.

T
Data type
XParam
Simulation parameters
XBlock
Block parameters
xo
X start
yo
Y start
xmax
X end
ymax
Y end
isEps
Whether to use epsilon margin
cornerblk
Vector to store corner block indices
Find the block containing the border of a rectangular box (used for the defining the output zones) The indice of the blocks are returned through "cornerblk" from bottom left turning in the clockwise direction

memberdef.argsstring: (Param XParam, BlockP< T > XBlock, Forcing< float > &XForcing, T *zb)
memberdef.name: calcactiveCellCPU

briefdescription.para: Calculates active cells in the domain based on mask elevation and area of interest.

detaileddescription.para: Sets the active cell flag for each cell, removing rain from masked and boundary cells as needed.

briefdescription.para: CUDA kernel to calculate active cells on the GPU based on mask elevation.

detaileddescription.para: Sets the active cell flag for each cell in the block using GPU parallelism.

memberdef.argsstring: (Param XParam, BlockP< T > XBlock, T *h, T *initLoss, T *hgw)
memberdef.name: initinfiltration

briefdescription.para: Initializes infiltration loss array for each cell.

detaileddescription.para: Sets initial infiltration loss to zero for wet cells.

briefdescription.para: Creates a vector of output times from the input time structure.

detaileddescription.para: Combines independent values and time steps from the input structure.

briefdescription.para: Compiles and sorts output times for map outputs, including zone outputs.

detaileddescription.para: Combines times from the main output structure and all zone outputs, sorts and removes duplicates, and assigns to output arrays.
Creation of a vector for times requiering a map output Compilations of vectors and independent times from the general input and the different zones outputs
